website_summaries.verdict: A top pick for wearers who want to save money and have reliable support and pain relief.
pros: An affordable top-seller by a trusted name in foot care
Features shock-guard technology that provides both support and comfort
cons: Support is slightly lacking for very high arches
Requires trimming to fit, but this isn't too difficult to do

customer_reviews.title: Relief for planter fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Wow. If you suffer from planter fasciitis like I do, you need these. It was instant relief. I have a weekend job where I'm on my feet all day, 11 hours. Its amazing how instantly these worked. About 2 months in and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Riebe

customer_reviews.title: Believe it! Relief is possible. Try these.
customer_reviews.text: This works! I tried NSAID's, frozen water bottles, stretching exercises, and several pairs of new shoes. 3 months of suffering gone the first day I used these. You will initially think it is a mistake because they really put a lot of pressure on your arch, but that is how they work! Easy to trim for fit, I have used them in work boots, hiking boots, cowboy boots, and sneakers. Your cowboy boots might need to be a loose fit , but all other shoes they will work with your normal size.
customer_reviews.author: TomK2

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had plantar fasciitis in both feet for two yrs now. I have tried many different insoles and this is the first pair that have given me any relief. I bought several pairs and insert them into other shoes. I’m still limited in what shoes I can wear, so far saucony sneakers work for me with these insoles. I don’t have perfect relief, but these have made me much more comfortable in combination with foot exercises I do on a daily basis, I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: grebo

customer_reviews.title: I will only use this brand
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended another brand of insoles by a doctor (called Super Feet). It actually made my feet feel worse. I'm not sure why I didn't just buy Dr. Scholls inserts. I have heal pain (Plantar Fasciitis - hope I spelled that right) but 1 week after using these daily, the pain was gone. I highly recommend these. They are comfortable. Easy to trim to size. I'll never use another brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C4

customer_reviews.title: NOT Recommended for working for a long time
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 different kinds at the same time because I really needed heel support but this was the worst of 3. I started feeling pain after a few hours since I wore them. I had even more pain than usual because the product was thick so my big and pinky toes touched both sides of shoes which never happened before. You need one size bigger shoes in order to wear this. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: SubinBella

customer_reviews.title: Worked extremely well for me - pain melted away after a few hours!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this product. I had a bout of plantar fasciitis years back that was corrected with some regular arch supports. This time it was worse, and I couldn't fix it with the normal arches. After a simple and easy sizing of these inserts (with regular scissors), I put these in my shoes, and initially the pain was worse... but after a few hours, it melted away. It's like night and day with these -- if I go without these inserts one day, by the evening the pain is back. While using these, I am virtually pain free.
customer_reviews.author: Peter James Erikson

customer_reviews.title: my foot hurt worse after
customer_reviews.text: Did nothing for my plantar. my foot hurt worse after inserts
customer_reviews.author: Samatha Pringle

customer_reviews.title: Best to use with larger feet
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping these would work for my size 6 foot but they do not. I did trim the toe area to fit my size but the insert is too wide to fit into my shoes. Since I can't return them I will cut the sides down to fit in my shoes to see if that helps. Oh well. Too late to return now. I do not recommend these to people with smaller feet. Learned a lesson here.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my plantar fasciitis pain after a week or so
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these insoles because I’ve had increasingly worse plantar fasciitis pain in both my feet, by especially my right, to the point I couldn’t walk on it in the morning most days. At first they didn’t seem to help, as I still had pain while walking with them, but they aren’t meant to be an immediate fix, as I discovered after a week or so, but they really worked to stretch my arch and get rid of the pain when I wasn’t wearing them. Now, about a month later, I don’t have any plantar fasciitis pain anymore after wearing them everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Not for people who are standing for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.text: I have bone spurs and was looking for pain relief in my heels while standing for long periods of time or walking. By the end of the first day, my heels were in pain and swollen. Perhaps these are better for people with more sedentary jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Nino

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful
customer_reviews.text: These are fine for regular shoe inserts, but they didn't relieve my plantar fasciitis pain. They just aren't tall enough or firm enough. I'll link you to the product that eventually did help me get long-term relief.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: You Want Cheap Buy These. You Want Effectiveness Buy Superfeet.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used them, both feet hurt. After a half a mile I had to sit down. The pain in my arches was awful. I am a Superfeet guy and thought I'd buy these because they were cheap ($14+) compared to Superfeet ($55+). Price is the only thing going for these but with Superfeet I can walk miles and there is no pain. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: I've never left a review. This will be my first and I WISH it was a positive review. I work 12 hour shifts and I'm also pregnant. I have so much heel pain its ridiculous. I bought these because everyone and their mother said to buy inserts. Waste of my money! My feet hurt 3 hours into my shift. Usually they dont hurt until the last 3 hours. Glad it worked for other people but sadly it didnt for me. The biggest issue was the hard part in the middle that provides "support" (the light blue section). Guess I'll try compression socks or new shoes.... AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable... but most of my shoes get too tight.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. But in order for me to wear dress shoes, boots, and anything other than a flimsy loafer, this is too thick to insert into shoes (even shoes that are a half size too big). It works on one pair of my shoes at least. But my work shoes become too tight when I have to cram my foot and these into my shoe. I can imagine it's much worse if you wear shoes snugly (exactly your size). I'm not sure if/how this could be rectified but the fact remains, I unfortunately can't wear these with most of my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Rated R Cars

customer_reviews.title: Delays pain, but doesn't alleviate
customer_reviews.text: If my day is filled with errands, I try to wear my New Balance Minimus Trail Running Shoe. I have a weird gait so a lite running shoe helps. If you are familiar with this shoe, you know its pretty flat with relatively no support. I purchased the insole to help offset the lack of support and flatness of the shoe. I do suffer from plantar fasciitis so a day in my running shoe spells pain the next day. I thought insole would help to alleviate the next day pain, but it didn't. However, it has been instrumental in longer walks without heel pain.
customer_reviews.author: GIVONNE

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: I have a high arch and plantar fasciitis. These are flimsy and have no support for arches. I do not recommend these at all.
customer_reviews.author: BleekersDoc

customer_reviews.title: Package was opened, maybe even used.
customer_reviews.text: This review is not for the product itself but for the way in which I received this product- OPEN and quite possibly used. Also, the description states it fits a woman 6-10, this thing is humongous and couldn’t possibly fit into a 6 woman’s shoe, not even with “trimming edges”. I am very upset.
customer_reviews.author: Lizette Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Made my foot hurt more
customer_reviews.text: These made my foot hurt more than it did before using them. The arch is in the wrong place and hits my painful heel. The seem well made but they make the pain so much worse for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie B

customer_reviews.title: It’s not working as Advertised and it’s not giving you relief
customer_reviews.text: It’s not working as Advertised and I don’t feel any difference while using this soles. I bought this after seeing so many good reviews and I bound 2 pairs for my 2 different shoes and it’s not working at all . Don’t spend your money on this. I’ve been using this soles for last 2 months but no relief. It’s not at all working and relieve you from the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Sasi Kiran

customer_reviews.title: Supportive insoles create more issues
customer_reviews.text: While these insoles were supportive I can’t really recommend them. Because they are sized to fit so many different shoe sizes the arch isn’t in exactly the right place. The biggest problem is that the trim to fit part for the front of the foot is too thick and takes up so much room that my shoes feel at least a full size too small and my toes are crowded and crunched so I’m just in a different type of pain. I have ordered 3/4 length insoles, hopefully they do a better job.
customer_reviews.author: cmcoufal

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these! After wearing them for the first day on a 10-hour shift my feet felt great. I had purchased these to replace the half size kind of heel inserts that kept moving around with every step. I'm very pleased with these full-length inserts they don't move around in my shoe at all and don't take up much extra space in my shoes so my feet aren't cramped. I highly recommend for plantar fasciitis pain!
customer_reviews.author: CareaBearaSara

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with Continued Use
customer_reviews.text: I had Plantar Fasciitis a few years ago, and ever since, I've worn these inserts while running without issue. I usually replace them every 6 months or so. It was time for a new replacement and for some dumb reason, I decided to try the Dr. Scholl running inserts instead. Plantar Fasciitis pain started within just a day or two. Swapped them out for a new pair of these Dr. Scholl Plantar Fasciitis inserts and everything is golden again.
customer_reviews.author: SJU82

customer_reviews.title: Dr Scholl's is not the answer
customer_reviews.text: Provides temporary relief for a bigger problem. If you go to a podiatrist, a good podiatrist they will tell you that anything Dr Scholl's is pointless. A temporary fix. I have found that to be true. It provides a temporary fix and comfort for soreness and bruising but does not take care of the overall issue. Finding the right shoe and support ultimately fixes 100% of the issue. It takes someone that knows what they are doing not your average person in the mall shoe store. These inserts are just a Band-Aid over a much larger problem and do not fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Sloppy McFloppy

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money! They were very uncomfortable and did not help my plantar fasciitis at all. Go see a podiatrist for the real deal. I wish I had not waited so long to come to that conclusion.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These really do work for plantar fasciitis pain, but if you walk a lot, they only last a few months
customer_reviews.text: I had been dealing with Plantar Fasciitis for a while, and when we'd walk regularly, I'd have a fair amount of pain at the end of each walk. I decided to give these a try, and sure enough, they have really helped control the PF, and I rarely have pain now. I can tell they are starting to wear out when we do walks and my foot is more sore than normal. Definitely recommend them if you suffer the same.
customer_reviews.author: Russel A. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Did not help at all
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting a lot better being scholls. Inserts don’t fit properly. I wear a size 8.5 shoe and these were huge and wide. Had to cut and then they fit even weirder. Got a horrible blister on the back of my foot after wearing these once. Did not help with the planters factitious. If anything made it worse. :(
customer_reviews.author: LittlemrsC

customer_reviews.title: My go-to replacement insert
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other, cheaper (though for around $15 you can't get much cheaper than these) insoles but didn't find them as comfortable as Dr. Scholl's. I believe the packaging suggests these be replaced about every six months, which is probably a good idea, though I've had some that lasted longer (maybe in shoes that I don't wear every day). The arch support on these feels perfectly placed: it doesn't feel like it's in the wrong place, as with some of those other cheaper brands. These are a bit on the thicker side so you'll want to make sure your shoes have plenty of space to accept them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: really good to replace insoles on hard to fit shoes
customer_reviews.text: i have a pair of expensive designer slip ons that do not provide enough arch support for my flat feet and planter's fascitis. i tried to put my nazaroo insole in without success. that insole was much too stiff and wide and i didn't feel like cutting them down to fit as it would ruin using them for another shoe. so i bought these knowing that they could be trimmed. i used my insole from my prada shoes and cut along the original insole and these slipped right in. they provide adequate support. not as good as my nazaroo but they make the shoes much more comfortable and wearable.
customer_reviews.author: kandylandmo

customer_reviews.title: Made my heel hurt more
customer_reviews.text: These require removal of existing sneaker insole. Not all my shoes are made that way. These made my heel hurt more than the shoes themselves were doing. They ended up in a pair of slippers that are worn out. They make my bare feet sweat and in a very short time, they stink. I have washed them by hand in the sink with dish detergent and they come out smelling ok. Then the cycle starts again. They failed at the intended purpose of relieving heel pain in my every day sneakers. The heel cup is rather hard and thick so it only put more pressure on my heel causing me pain.
customer_reviews.author: Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t help my plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I wear Dr. Scholl’s insoles on a daily basis and they are great for keeping me from having sore feet and legs at the end of the day. However, when I got plantar fasciitis, these were no better at relieving it than the regular kind - which is to say, not at all. I also got a cheaper brand (Walk Hero) and while they haven’t completely relieved the pain either, they have relieved more of it than these did. These might be good to wear daily and help to prevent plantar fasciitis, but they didn’t relieve it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Newcomb Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but these seem to have alleviated my plantar faciitis in just a couple of weeks. I walk 10 to 15 thousand steps a day and putting these in my ASICs has resolved my plantar faciitis pain that I had every day.
customer_reviews.author: James02

customer_reviews.title: Important part of a comprehensiv treatment
customer_reviews.text: I am not a doctor but...If you suffer from plantar fasciitis you know it is no laughing matter. These insoles helped me. I bought several pairs of them. I also wear a night splint like this one: BraceAbility Boot  I put one of the insoles in the bottom of the boot. Don't know if it's just me but I had tried several other styles that I ordered online and was less then 100% satisfied. I got the BraceAbility Boot from my doctor and it has really helped. I wear it every night and I highly recommend it. I also do runners stretches in the morning to stretch out the calf muscles and tendons.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Schindehette

customer_reviews.title: Arch collapses
customer_reviews.text: No support at all, the arch collapses as soon as you step on it. I’m disappointed but unfortunately did not save the package to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Definitely can recommend.
customer_reviews.text: These inserts appear to work just fine and immediately began to provide me relief. I have a double problem of plantar fasciitis and achilles bursitis. Nothing is perfect in providing total relief, but this insert helped as soon as I stepped into it and have continued for several days to help me walk normally where before walking was near impossible. I hope that with time, the condition will subside, but I certainly have no concerns about continuing to use them.
customer_reviews.author: richlife

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING !!!! I am not the biggest cowboy boot man, but there’s a 1 week rodeo that goes on in my town which is the only exception of me wearing boots and the very first time me wearing boots was horrible Especially standing there for long period of time. The following year I went I had to purchase these and let me tell you the most amazing purchase I’ve ever made in my life, literally the most comfortable soles in the world. Absolutely amazing seriously. One thing I’d change is a little more padding on the bottom for support when standing for a long period of time. Otherwise absolutely amazing would definitely buy again ! You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Frias

customer_reviews.title: Plantar Fasciitis comeback is not fun
customer_reviews.text: Plantar Fasciitis started to come back. I immediately threw away my old worn out heal version ones. Then used these full insole versions. After a couple weeks the Plantar Fasciitis has gone away. They truly make a difference. I would love to have a way to test these inserts to know when to get rid of them and get new ones. I suppose if I just do it once a year it should work. I might consider if it exists to buy a bulk set for all my different shoes and when they wear out.
customer_reviews.author: nomarkers

customer_reviews.title: RELIEF FROM THE PAIN.
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS ORIGINALLY FOR MYSELF BUT MY GRAND D, LIVES WITH ME COMES HOME FROM WORK LIMPING EVERYDAY SO I GAVE THEM TO HER AND REORDERED FOR ME. SHE SAID AFTER WORKING AND WALKING HER FUL SHIFT HER FEET FELT GREAT NO PAIN AND LIMPING WHEN SHE GOT HOME. I AM THE SAME WAY NOW THAT I HAVE MY OWN PAIR. WILL BE BUYING AGAIN I AM SURE.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Milan

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: My feet are usually killing me on long hikes, amusement park trips, etc. With an upcoming Disney trip, I was recommended to get some of these. I put them in some new shoes I needed to break in for the trip and have been walking daily on my treadmill. First off, these were much more comfortable and supportive than the ones that came with my new shoes. Secondly, my feet have not hurt at all. I'm not walking more than 30 minutes at a time, so I will have to update after my trip, but I think these will make a huge difference!
customer_reviews.author: KRout

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work but made pain more severe!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me. I took the original insoles from my boots and replaced it with these thinking it was going to help me a little with the plantar fasciitis on my left heel. Only to it making it worse. My ability to walk around was shortened due to the increase in pain on my first night having these insoles in. I did not have this problem with my regular insole. Soo...3 stars for the fast delivery, ease of use, and the price was average. Definitely taking these back out and putting my regular insoles in.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Black

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I put these in my shoes my pain was practically gone. I have very bad pain in both of my heels and I could hardly walk. I had to make pads in my shoes to walk ugh! But these are such a relief for my heels. I would buy them again even if the price was higher.In fact I'm getting some for my slippers.
customer_reviews.author: patricia woods

customer_reviews.title: This helps the pain
customer_reviews.text: I recently (within the last 3-4 months) have heel pain which i self diagnosed to plantar fascitis. Doctor agreed. First it was just my one foot; now it's both. So I am trying to find shoes that don't cost $100 that aren't painful. This insert helps! I put it in "normal" shoes. I had my shoes on all day and my heels weren't as sore. So I am going to try finding $20-$30 shoes with removable inserts, putting these $10-$15 inserts in and see how that works. So far, so good. HIghly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Busted and cracked once frozen
customer_reviews.text: I followed all the directions for the massage ball and it busted and cracked once frozen. I’m optimistic based on other reviews and want to return this and purchase again. I may add less water, though I did not add excess according to the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Childers

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but quality...?!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product since I tried. After 6-month daily use, I got this. I’m just curious if this is typical worn-out of this product or quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: KJ Lee

customer_reviews.title: Relieves pain immediately
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I had to this time. I'm a chef so I'm on my feet 60 hours a week at work. I've been experiencing extreme heel pain in my left foot for weeks. After I take my shoes off and sit down when I get home I experience shooting pain in my heal when I stand back up. It hurts so bad I have a hard time walking. After some research I decided to purchase these inserts as my first attempt to correct this pain. I wore them for the first time today and upon taking off my shoes tonight I am not in any pain! I can't believe it!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Adams

customer_reviews.title: Not good for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a pair of Dr. Scholl's "Gelling" comfort inserts. Do not purchase these if you're looking to correct flat feet or any serious plantar problems... they offer no support, only some slight cushioning/comfort. I guess if you have VERY minor plantar issues these may work for you, but if you're trying to correct a problem with your feet these will not cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Friendly Consumer

customer_reviews.title: It really did work!
customer_reviews.text: I had planter's fasciitis in one foot. Every morning when I woke up I simply couldn't even walk it hurt so bad. I bought these because they were an inexpensive solution and switch these inserts out depending upon which shoes I am wearing. I don't even use them all the time now and my problem went away. But, they provide great support. I could tell immediately when I put them on that I had problems with my arc and it really did correct it.
customer_reviews.author: jcurrier

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't work without them
customer_reviews.text: I put these in my (women's) Easy Spirit shoes. I'm a CNA. I'm on my feet for up to 12 hours/day. Before I got these, I could barely walk after a shift was over. Now I can walk. I still have pain. These didn't cure everything. But they give me more cushion than the shoes did. I can tell that after many wears...the cushioning isn't as lofty as it was at first. Still good enough for now. I have plantar fasciatis, so I hurt everytime I walk.
customer_reviews.author: J. CannonTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Good insole, but not sure it helps my plantar at all
customer_reviews.text: So, this is a comfy, supportive insole that I enjoy using. However, it does not seem to help my plantar fasciitis at all. If it were advertised as a general foot support in-sole, then five stars. But since it does not seem to help the condition (at least for me), I have to knock a couple stars.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Does not ease pain
customer_reviews.text: Just bought these inserts specifically for Plantar Fasciitis relief. After trimming and inserting in shoes I went on my 3 mi. walk this morning. The pain is much worse than before. I went to the Dr Scholl's site to return inserts to see that I would get a refund if I package and ship these inserts back using a USPS Priority 2-Day Flat Rate Envelope. They do not pay shipping costs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Tried these after reading a very positive review on a newspaper's web site, but quickly found out their arch support is poor - not even as good as other "models" of Dr Scholl inserts I've purchased in the past. Back they go!
customer_reviews.author: RF456

customer_reviews.title: been using them for 2 years...
customer_reviews.text: ... not the same pair obviously. I have plantar faciitus in my right heel (not sever) and these help. They don't completely stop the condition but they are 'close enough'. I also have to try to remember not to pivot on that right foot. Getting old sux but it beats the alternative.
customer_reviews.author: The Stick Man

customer_reviews.title: Not the same !!!
customer_reviews.text: Second time I ordered these here on Amazon. First pair were great! Support and relief from pain. I switched them to my work boots and bought a second pair for my Skechers. ABSOLUTELY NOT THE SAME IN COMFORT, ARCH SUPPORT OR PAIN RELIEF!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works to relive heel pain
customer_reviews.text: Had to cut the whole front end off and just use arch support and back to heel, because an additional insole was too much for my toes. Works great, I can feel the difference into the whole second day after wearing them, and enjoy flat shoes once in a while. Had to discard and buy the $18 version of same brand that is not so hefty in the toes, just could not fit into my shoes
customer_reviews.author: CLINKC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Planta Fasciitis pain
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom who was having bad foot pain due to plantar fasciitis. She says it's amazing and helps with the pain and her recovery tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Shorago

customer_reviews.title: Got relief and they add comfort too
customer_reviews.text: I have had issues with plantar fasciitis for almost 2years. I have tried may different things. I have had no issues for a couple months. With using this and a combination of support sleeve and excersices the doc recommended. But in my mind these are the most important part of relief I can’t even imagine wearing shoes without them in at this point. They add support and comfort. If you are looking for a cheap way for relief I would try this first. Plantar fasciitis can be fickle and very painful. But this should (in one mans opinion) should be your first step toward recovery.
customer_reviews.author: A guy buying stuff

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have been walking an hour or more a day to stay active during the pandemic and these inserts have greatly helped with my plantar fasciitis. I noticed a big difference in comfort when I started using them! They are very easy to cut down to size. There is a shoe size indicator on the back and you can trim down, if needed, with a pair of scissors. I even added a pair to my slippers for extra cushioning. I have hand washed the inserts with liquid hand soap and air dried.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING, LIFE CHANGING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product coming after a very successful visit to a physical therapist helped me put plantar fasciitis in the rear view mirror! I was in agony and now that is only a memory! If you want relief from one of the most dreadful and agonizingly painful conditions, this will fix it!! And for hardly any money!!!!!!!!!!!! Thank you for coming up with this product!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MB Silver

customer_reviews.title: Relief at last!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Bought them to wear in my work shoes as I spend a good deal of the day walking at my job and they really helped with the pain in my heel!!! My only complaint is that they seem to run a tiny bit small in regard to the shoe size - I am a 9.5 in women's and they are just a tiny bit short for my shoes but really its more of a nitpicky complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Ronni

customer_reviews.title: Work well, smell bad
customer_reviews.text: These support the arches of my feet just fine, but they smell terrible in a way that none of my other shoe inserts do. I've worn these and others barefoot, and only these smell awful. Not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work GREAT! I bought multiple pairs to keep in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to dread putting my feet down from the bed in the mornings. After the first full day of wearing these, I couldn't believe I was able to stand without pain. They work GREAT! I bought multiple pairs to keep in my different shoes. They are a bit wide, and I can already tell they are warping my dress shoes, but I don't really care. Shoes come and go but The Pain is Gone. Priceless =)
customer_reviews.author: Ali R. Samsami

customer_reviews.title: Posterior Tibial Tendonitis, these help!
customer_reviews.text: I have a dysfunctional posterior tibial tendon and the pain in my heel from it mimics plantar fasciitis. These insoles actually make a difference. I can walk for hours, and even run, with these in my athletic shoes. Really excited that one of the 20 pairs of insoles I have bought over the years has finally worked.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I started having plantar fasciitis pain in 1 foot. I’m an RN so I’m on my feet a lot during my 12 hour shift. I put these in my work sneakers and now the pain is gone. They’re comfortable and provide more cushion in my shoe. I do have to be careful about how tight I tie my laces now that there’s additional support in my shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Shaunte'

customer_reviews.title: Prevented usual flare up from backpacking 😁
customer_reviews.text: Easy to cut to size (using the original insert I was replacing as a guide). I used them in trail runners to backpack for three days and I didn't get a flare up of my plantar fasciitis as I expected, , so I am concluding they helped prevent it. Would recommend for anyone who has/has had plantar fasciitis. Nice cushioning in the heel.
customer_reviews.author: Ellyn D.

customer_reviews.title: Relief for Plantar Fasciitis pain
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent. After wearing inside of a light tennis shoe for one day around the house, pain was completely gone at the end of the day and absent the next morning. Put these in all your shoes and wear Telic (US Made!) indoors instead of barefoot. Remove the shoe's insert, trace the pattern on the new insert, and cut.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Fithian

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Alleviated plantar fascitis pain within the first few days. Dont waste your money on the expensive insoles at the Drs. Office. Spend 1/4 of the money and become pain free!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Gellin like a felon.
customer_reviews.text: These have saved my life. I could barely walk and these offered immediate support, comfort and pain relief. Only issue is they seem to wear out pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Christoval

customer_reviews.title: Good under foot but too thick for most shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been really looking for a good foot support since I have plantar fasciitis. However, this one though feels very comfortable, doesn't actually fit when it's in my shoe. It makes it even harder to put on most shoes as my foot would be jammed against the roof of my shoe. I wish they made this thinner.
customer_reviews.author: KZ1221

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like these at all. They fit weird in all my sneakers, highly uncomfortable and don't relieve any pain. Unfortunately, I waited too long to put them in my sneakers only to realize they aren't for me and now it's too late to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Too Soft, Lacks Support, Wrong Shape for Shoes
customer_reviews.text: The insole is too soft and flexible. It does not provide the support necessary to relieve the discomfort of plantar fasciitis. It is not the correct shape to fit in shoes designed for right and left feet. Though insoles are marked right and left they are too straight and fit neither the right or the left shoe very well. I found the Dr Scholl's Sport insole much better at relieving my plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: M. Otten

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These have definitely helped support my feet and provided pain relief. It seems to have worked better than the compression socks I bought. I work a job where I am on my feet 10+ hours a day with minimal down time. Within just a few days, I've noticed a huge reduction in pain in the heel and arch area of the foot.
customer_reviews.author: rcn

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: These insoles help to alleviate my heel pain. My orthopedic shoes work better, but I use these in my tennis shoes that are not orthopedic and it makes the pain significantly less that if I don't use anything. I will repurchase when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gemstones

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had purchased these earlier
customer_reviews.text: I had tried different methods to deal with plantar fasciitis with only having limited results. I noticed an immediate difference the first time I had these in my shoes. My foot didn't hurt as much and it didn't hurt as much following the walk. I'm finally making some real progress in getting healed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fluffy

customer_reviews.title: I have a high arch so these did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: One size does not fit all. My Dad has a lower arch with planar faciitis so this worked for him. My arch is higher so it did not work for my planar faciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I have hiking shoes that I absolutely love wearing but they caused my plantar fascitis to start ...
customer_reviews.text: I have hiking shoes that I absolutely love wearing but they caused my plantar fascitis to start up in one heel (never had a problem before wearing those shoes regularly). Put this in the shoe and I've not had too much of a problem since. (Will update review if needed though as I have not worn them day in and day out like I used to in fall/winter/spring).
customer_reviews.author: Lolaloo

customer_reviews.title: Miracle fix.
customer_reviews.text: Miracle insoles. I had a tear in the medial cord with distal retraction. Very painful. These gave me my foot back. Worth buying at any price.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: so helpful
customer_reviews.text: Im dealing with plantar fascitis and there are so few shoes that are comfortable at the moment, so these are a lifesaver. I wish they made some that stopped right after the arch support, as I have a few pairs of shoes that become too tight in the toe box with the inserts there, so I have to try to trim them down below the ball of my foot so they fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Belden

customer_reviews.title: Beyond amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these one day!!! I got plantar fasciitis and I don’t have money for expensive shoes so I thought I’d give this a try and as of my first day driving up a mountain and walking I have not felt any pain of plantar fasciitis. These are amazing. Give them a try. They might work for you, I mean it!
customer_reviews.author: JenJen

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief
customer_reviews.text: Waking up with pain in my feet and legs, walking around my apt to make the pain go away and feeling like a nerve is being pulled from the toe to the hill. I work standing and running around a lot and living in NY you gotta walk like a lot, and fast (please) and these insoles fixed that pain and made all that walking a lot easier. I would totally recommend, they were a game changer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Novelo

customer_reviews.title: Not for plantar fasciitis!
customer_reviews.text: I have heel pains. Before I saw a foot doctor I bought these insoles hoping to relieve my pain. They did not seem to work. When I went to see my doctor, he looked at these insoles and told me they are too soft to provide support. I need a rigid insole with higher arch support. I had already cut the insoles to fit my shoes, too bad I can't return them anymore. I should have asked my doctor before buying.
customer_reviews.author: M Tung

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but works
customer_reviews.text: Bought these hoping they relieve pain as nothing else would help. First day I put them on pain went away. Almost two weeks in and pain has not returned and I can run now
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Best. Decision. Ever!! In fact I ordered more for my other shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: I work retail so I'm on my feet all day. My heels have been hurting so bad I have a hard time waking around after work. In desperation I went to Amazon and searched for hell pain relief inserts and these were part of the results. I read some reviews & given the price I ordered them. Best. Decision. Ever!! In fact I ordered more for my other shoes!! I could comfortably walk my dog after work!!! Very little heel pain after a full 9 hour day! Woop Woop!
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Minimal relief from Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: These really did not give much relieve from Plantar Fasciitis. Also hard to get fit into sneaker. Outside sole does not match inside of shoe and cutting them is hard.
customer_reviews.author: LoriP

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I’m wearing these right now, and have worn them everyday since I got them. They are really helpful. I have plantar fasciitis and they do ease the pain for sure. My podiatrist says they aren’t enough support though, so if your looking for that reason, she suggested something with a more solid arch, these are pretty flexy bendy.
customer_reviews.author: Friendlyvelociraptor

customer_reviews.title: They’re okay
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if my plantar fasciitis is just so bad that nothing is going to feel good, but I was expecting a little more from these. They do make walking a little more comfortable but I don’t feel like they gave me the best arch support even though I measured and cut them properly. I still wear them, I just thought they’d be a little more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S.

customer_reviews.title: Heel pain gone, but very narrow
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy , definitely helped with my heel pain , but very narrow , they leave a small gap between the bottom of my shoe and the insole , my pinky toe would hang off , going to buy another pair and try to cut them better but even with the other side that seems to fit better you can still see a small space in between. Wanted the insole to really fill out my shoe . Could just be a problem I have personally , just seems to be very narrow .But still super comfy on my heel which was my main concern
customer_reviews.author: sese

customer_reviews.title: Your heels hurt? These help for sure.
customer_reviews.text: I hate my foot pain because it makes me feel old, even though I’m not in my 30s yet. These inserts are amazing though. I work 8 hours on my feet everyday and I come home without the pain that I’ve always felt. I recommend these to eliminate or reduce the pain that comes with having cursed weird feet.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene M

customer_reviews.title: Worst insole ever
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all. The enforcement was too much and I am always told I have high arches. Worst of all, the cutting guide for the doe size was not shaped or sized to work. Didn't mold around my feet nor shoe. As a result I had too little and then too much cut off. Had to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Its good.
customer_reviews.text: I work at machine shop where I constantly have to stand throughout the day. When my feet started hurting, I quickly bought these and replaced the soles from my work boots. It did relieve a lot of the stress on my feet and made it easier to get through the day. A quick note: Do not expect miracles, its suppose to relieve the pain not get rid of it. If your truly looking to stop the pain, schedule an appointment with your doctor for an analysis and go from there.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. Not much arch support and didn't make a big difference for my plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyproduce

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my husband needed
customer_reviews.text: My husband's feet were hurting him, he went and bought something at Walmart and it only helped a bit. I decided to buy these for him, and it was amazing. Pain went away that same day, by the next day he was 110%. I decided to buy 2 more to have in hand for his other shoes. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: So excited to receive it and used it the following day. Happy with the left but there is sadly something off with the right part. Bugged me the whole time. I have already cut it off so I am not sure if I can still return them. Just be aware. Might not be right for you. 😞
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: little, to no arch support
customer_reviews.text: Item is soft and easy to cut to size, shape of existing insole, however, the arch gives moderate support. The entire insole is comfortable, but is of lesser quality/support than existing insole in my Ariat ridding boots. (need more heel cushion ). These probably would be okay for putting into cheaper shoes for nicer insoles.
customer_reviews.author: The Madras Bee

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. These have helped my husband’s planter fasciitis better ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. These have helped my husband’s planter fasciitis better than insoles he bought from a podiatrist. He was having a lot of heel pain so we decided to try something different. He has been using them about 2 weeks and his pain is much better. Has a lot of heel cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Naa

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief
customer_reviews.text: After my accident I had very painful feet pain. The doctor said that I had plantar fasciitis. I refused to get the shots. I put these in my tennis shoes and it helped the pain go away while on my feet at work.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: I have happy feet again
customer_reviews.text: I have happy feet again!! Strong support right where you need it, just in front of your heel. A gentle lift for the rest of the tendon and great cushioning for the heel bone. My feet feel wonderful when I wear shoes/boots with these in them. Why didn't I try these a long, long time ago? Wasted a lot of money on other orthotics, that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses these constantly. He says they help a lot with his PF. However, he wishes they were a bit wider.
customer_reviews.author: Cecillia J

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Big difference
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy these, I am a size 10 Womens with flat feet and took these backpacking europe. They dont slide around and have good support. Paired well with my nikes.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Cured my plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I walk a lot during my commute and over time developed plantar fasciitis. My doctor recommended these insoles. After only a week of wearing them, the plantar fasciitis is gone, and my foot has healed. Get them. They work.
customer_reviews.author: toolsa

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t make a huge difference in my back pain after using it for 2 months now. Gives more cushion to your feet, but for the first few weeks only, after that it feels just like a normal insole.
customer_reviews.author: Ardalan A.Moghadam

customer_reviews.title: Good Alternative Vs Going To Doctor
customer_reviews.text: I told my doctor I'm using them for my heel and she agreed this with exercise would help my foot. We are hoping I can wait another month and then go when it's hopefully safer. So far so good but they do slip and wear a sock for extra comfort. Stay Safe!
customer_reviews.author: cg

product_meta.title: Dr. Scholl’s PLANTAR FASCIITIS Pain Relief Orthotics // Clinically Proven Relief and Prevention of Plantar Fasciitis Pain (for Men's 8-13, also available for Women's 6-10)
product_meta.description:
Style:Men's 8-14We designed Dr. Scholl’s Pain Relief Orthotics for Plantar Fasciitis specifically for people who suffer pain from plantar fasciitis in the heel. They have Shock Guard Technology to provide immediate and all-day relief of pain from plantar fasciitis and can help reduce morning pain from plantar fasciitis. The package contains one pair of insoles to fit men's shoe sizes 8-13. Dr. Scholl's has been a trusted brand in foot care since 1904 when Dr. William Mathias Scholl, grandson of a cobbler, launched the company under the name Dr. Scholl Inc.

Covered by the Bayer HealthCare LLC – Consumer Health 60-Day Satisfaction Guarantee. See below for details

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
973-254-5000
feature_bullets: Designed for people who suffer pain from plantar fasciitis in the heel
With Shock Guard Technology to provide immediate and all-day relief of pain from plantar fasciitis and can help reduce morning pain from plantar fasciitis
Full-length insole cushions and supports the entire foot
Fits Casual shoes, Sneakers & Work boots/shoes. Trim to fit shoe size

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
